revised_title: Experiments and Observations on the Structure of Nerves and the Transparency of the Retina
tldr: The author investigates the structure and transparency of the optic nerve and retina in animals, particularly cats, using microscopes and experiments. The study reveals that the retina is transparent during life, and the optic nerve has a semi-transparent internal structure. The findings challenge previous theories on nerve structure and contribute to the understanding of the eye's luminous appearance.
